answers.answer: I'm 35wks and baby is measuring 6lbs 12oz, my first was 10.1lbs at birth.
Is that big at 35 weeks? And did you have him normal or csection?
I had my first vaginally, and yes 6lbs 12oz is bigger for 35wks, the average weight at 35wks is around 5.25lbs

question: I just came back from my appointment and my dc told me that my baby is measuring big because at 30 weeks she was 4pounds 7oz now im 32 wks. I have no diabetes and my weight  is normal (19pounds gain) and my stomach is not measuring big either,  she said that she want to do another ultrasound at 38 weeks to see if shes 10 pounds and if she is im gonna have a csection im stressing out because my first baby was 7 pounds and with him I did have diabetes!
title: baby measuring big
